docs.lead_paragraph: The Times is tracking donors to “super PACs” as they filed regular reports with the Federal Election Commission.
docs.snippet: The Times is tracking donors to “super PACs” as they filed regular reports with the Federal Election Commission.

docs.lead_paragraph: Developers in the last half-century called it progress when they built homes and shopping malls far from city centers throughout the country, sounding the death knell for many downtowns. But now an alarmed cadre of public health experts say these expanded metropolitan areas have had a far more serious impact on the people who live there by creating vehicle-dependent environments that foster obesity, poor health, social isolation, excessive stress and depression. As a result, these experts say, our ''built environment'' - where we live, work, play and shop - has become a leading cause of disability and death in the 21st century. Physical activity has been disappearing from the lives of young and old, and many communities are virtual ''food deserts,'' serviced only by convenience stores that stock nutrient-poor prepared foods and drinks.

headline.main: Personal Health: Communities Learn the Good Life Can Be a Killer

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column describes research finding that the sedentary comforts of suburban expansion have fostered obesity, poor health, social isolation, excessive stress and depression. Photo (M)a

docs.lead_paragraph: The gold medalist Rulon Gardner is 40 years old and overweight, but he believes that he can qualify to wrestle at the Summer Games in London.

headline.seo: Wrestler Rulon Gardner Plots Comeback at London Olympics

docs.abstract: Rulon Gardner, winner of the wrestling gold medal in the 2000 Olympics, hopes to overcome being 40 years old and overweight in a comeback bid for the 2012 London Games.
docs.snippet: The gold medalist Rulon Gardner is 40 years old and overweight, but he believes that he can qualify to wrestle at the Summer Games in London.
